he sit down spreading his legs, and combed his hire in a conical shape.
The people of the Hàn dynasty praised Sū Wǔ, and blamed Zhào Tuó.
Because Zhào Tuó's nature had been affected by the uncivilised fashions of the Yuè,
and he had forsaken the rules of the cap and the girdle of Hàn.
When Lù Jiǎ pursuded him
clad in the Chinese way, and using civilised rituals
and admonished him with morality,
Zhào Tuó became awake,
and turned his heart to his native land[the Hàn].
If Lù Jiǎ again had worn the dress of the Yuè, had spoken in a barbarian language,
and had followed their disorder customs,
how could he have caused Zhào Tuó to be aware of his fault,
to reform himself, and to follow the rules of Hàn?
The doctrines of the three dynasties were disagreed,
and their substances and their emblishments were opposed,
bucause the former dynasty made mistakes in its political administration, the later would not follow it.107
Heaven reprimands the soveriegn for his mistake,
does not change the soveriegn's fault, but follows his mistake.
If heaven wishes to practise its reprimanding,
why does not it change another way? 108
When Guǎn and Cài did rebellion,
Duke Zhōu admonished them again and again.
Should the words that he used to admonish them
be that you should revolt?
It is human law to praise the good and hate the bad,
to offer the good with reward,
and to give the bad with punishment.
The law of heaven also ought to be so.
If punishments and rewards be not meted out in a proper way,
this is evil.
Now, heaven emits bad air to correspond to the sovereign's evil,
how then could the principle of hating the bad be preserved?
The Hàn dynasty improved the punishments for the hiding of criminals,
and drew up the law of no escaping together with other crimimals,
bucause they worried about that people would follow the criminals and would form clique with evil men.
If people had tied up criminal to hand over to the magistrates,
and had aparted from the criminals living in a different places,
then the law of hiding criminals, and no escaping with criminals would have dispensed with.
When Dí Yá gave a flavour to what he was cooking,
if it was too sour, then he poured water in,
and if it was too tastless, then he added salt.
Water and fire could regulate the taste,
therefore the food was neither too salty, nor too tasteless.
Now, punishments and rewards are not consistent with facts,
heaven does not make a different air to change the sovereign's faults,
but increases cold for cold,
and increases warm for warm,
this will be like the case that hating sour, but pouring it with salt,
and that hating tasteless, but pouring it with water.
According to this,
should the saying about the reprimands of heaven
be doubted?
or be believed?
Now, burning firewood and heating a cauldron,
if the fire is strong, then the water is hot;
and if the fire is weak, then the water remains cool.
In fact, political adiministration is like the fire,
and weather's cold and warm is like water's hot and cool.
We merely can say that, when the sovereign deals with his political affairs,
he does not keep the right way in rewarding and punishing,
and goes against the Yīn and the Yáng,
hence causes the air to be disharmonious.
How could we say that heaven emits cold and warm air for the sovereign's faults with the object of reprimanding
The theory of the Confucian school???
also announces that, if the sovereign makes mistakes in his political administration,
heaven produces extraodinary events;
if he does not change,
it falls down misfortunes to his people;
if he still does not change,
then it falls down misfortune upon his own person.
That first extraodinary events, afterwards calamities,
is the theory of first exhorations, then punishments.
I say that
this cannot be belived likewise.
If one plants something in summer,
it withers, and cannot grow up;
and if one reaps grain in autumn,
it lies about, and cannot be harvested.
In fact practising political administration
is like planting and reaping.
We merely can say that the sovereign's political administration is not consistent with the proper time,
hence weather and other things cause calamity;
how could we say that heaven produces extraodinary events to reprimand him,
and that heaven falls down calamity to punish him, if he does not change even then?
The saying of the Confucian school
is like the words of the common people.
In mid-summer the Yáng fluid is blazing hot,
and the Yīn rushs against it,
thus there is crashing and thunding,
which kill men or other creatures.
The common people hold this as heaven punishing hidden sins.
It sounds to be right at the surface,
but it is not so in substance.
Now, to say that heaven makes calamities for punishments and reprimands
is like to say that thunder kills a man for punishing his hidden sins.
This is a unreasonable statement,
and an untenable assertion.
Some say:
"Gǔ Zǐyún submitted a memorial to the emperor to explain the calamities,
pointed out that the calamities were the reprimands of heaven,
and that, if the emperor did not reform,
there would be calamities again,
so he hoped to wear instruments of torture to await the time.
Later on there really were calamities again.
If these calamities did not appear for reprimands,
why were there calamities again (later on)?
Zǐyún' s words were right,
hence later on there were calamities to prove his words."109???
I say that,
in fact calamities have their own signs,
and the Yīn and the Yáng fluids have their own begining and end.
By walking upon frost, one knows that hard ice will necessary appear,
which is the nature principle of heaven.
Zǐyún knew the symptoms of calamities,
and knew that they would appear again,
hence he borrowed the theory of the phenominalists
to prove his words,
and hoped to wear instruments of torture to await the time.
Just like that Yàn Zì noticed the "Hook Star" between the constellations of the "House" and the "Heart",
then he knew that there would be an earth-quake.
If Zǐyún had seen the "Hook Star",
then he would have said again that heaven punished the sovereign's political administration with the "Hook Star",
and that if the soverieign did not reform,
there would be a disaster of earth-quake.
Thus that Zǐyún hoping to wear instruments of torture to awaite the time,
is like that Zǐwéi hoping to lie on the step of the throne to await the planet Mars shifting its position.
This was the thing which was sure to take place,???
therefore the words of reprimands were believed.
What harm is there, if to say that Heaven gives reprimands to the sovereign????
The saying injures high Heaven's virtue,
and makes a natural and spontaneous thing turn into human being's thing,
therefore it is hard to be believed[listened].
To say that heaven reprimands (the sovereign)
is in order to praise heaven's intelligent[hearing and seeing],
now, on the contrary the virtue of heaven is injured by its wisdom[hearing and seeing].
How to know one's deafness?
because he hears distinctly;
How to know one's blindness?
because he see clearly;
and how to know one's madness?
because he speaks properly.
In fact, talking properly, hearing clearly and seeing distinctly,
are called by the Taoist school as deafness, blindness and madness.
Now, to say that heaven reprimands (the sovereign)
is equal to say that heaven is mad, blind and deaf.
The Yìjīng says:
"The great man equals Heaven and Earth in virtue."
Threrfore Tài Bó Said:
"Heaven does not speak,
but engrafts[plants] its principles in the worthies' hearts."
Consequently the virtue of the great man
is the virtue of Heaven;110
and the words of the wise
is the words of Heaven.
The great man criticize and the wise remonstrate,
which resembles the reprimands of Heaven,
now however they regard the calamities as heaven's reprimand,
therefore I doubt it.
The writtings of the Six Classics
are the words of the sages.
The reason why they always mention Heaven
is that they intend to reform the lawless, and to frighten the ignorant.
They wish make it understood that what they say is not only their opinion,
but also the minds of Heaven.
When they mention Heaven, they still base on people's hearts,
and do not refer to the blue body of the high heaven.
When the phinomenalists notice all the Six Classics mentioning Heaven,111
and that calamities often arrive,
then they fabricate the saying that Heaven reprimands the sovereign.
To prove the ancient by the present,
and to know Heaven by human being.112
"(Shùn) received (Yáo's) abdication from the Acoomplished Ancestor",
it is not siad that he received the abdication from Heaven.
Yáo knew the mind of Heaven in his heart.
Since Yáo handed over his position to Shùn,
Heaven also confered this position to Shùn,
therefore all the officials and the subjects became inclined to Shùn.
When Shùn confered his position to Yǔ,
and when Yǔ transmitted the sway to Qǐ,
they both proved Heaven's mind by people's hearts.
The Shījīng saying "Heaven is concerned about",
and the chapter Hóng Fàn of the Shàngshuū saying "Heaven feels very anger",
both use human's hearts to prove Heaven's mind.113
When King Wén and King Wǔ had died,
King Chéng being still immature,
and the institutions of the Zhōu dynasty being not yet completed,
Duke Zhōu acted as regent,
was there a instruction from Heaven at that time? (No)
Duke Zhōu only examined his own heart to guess the mind of Heaven.
Because the mind of high Heaven
is in the bosom of the sages;
and when heaven reprimands,
it is done through the mouth of the sages.
Now, people do not believe the words of the sages,
on the contrary they trust in the air of calamity,
and in light of this, they intend to make out Heaven's mind,
how far it is from the fact!
Now there is no sages in our world,
where to get the words of the sages, then?
Wise men are the men whose talents are near to be that of the sages,
hence they can rank closely after the sages as well.
Those who discuss calamities
have already doubted the saying that heaven reprimands human being by misfortunes.
They change into another saying, say:
"The calamities arriving
perhapes is due to that the sovereign affects haven by his political administration,
hence heaven emits its air to respond to it.
This can be likened to beat a drum with a drumstick,
and to knock a bell with a hammer;
the drum is like heaven,
the hammer is like the political administration,
and the sound of the drum and the bell resembles the response of heaven.
When the sovereign acts below,
then the air of heaven follows the sovereign's action to arrive."
I say that
this is worth doubting also.
In fact heaven can affect things,
but how can things move heaven?
Why?
Because human beings and other creatures depend upon heaven,
heaven is the master of human being and other creatures.
Therefore one syas:
"When Wáng Liáng whips the horses,
the carriage and the steeds run all over the plain."114
It is impossible that when the carriage and the steeds run all over the plain,
Wáng Liáng subsequently whips the horses.
When the hevenly air changes above,
human being and other creatures respond below.
As this reason, when heaven is about to rain,
Shāng Yáng begins to dance;
xx
Shāng Yáng
is the creature that knows the rain.
As soon as heaven is about to rain,
Shāng Yáng bends its one leg, and begins to dance.
Therefore, when heaven is going to rain,
the mole-crickets and ants moves their abodes,
the earth-worms come forth,
the strings of guitars become loose,
and the chronic diseases break out.
These are the proof of creatures being affected by heaven.
Therefore when heaven is about to blow,
the creatures dewelling in trees begin to act;
and when it is going to rain,
the creatures living in caves become excited.
This is because the fluid of wind and rain affects those creatures.
As a same reason, that people live between Heaven and Earth
is like fleas and bugs (living)inside the upper and lower garments,
and crickets and ants (living) in caves and crevices.
If fleas and bugs, or crickets and ants do mistakes[go against or follow]116
can they cause the air inside the garments and caves to change?
Fleas and bugs, crickets and ants cannot do this,
but they pretend that human being can do this alone,
they must not know the theory about the relation between air and creatures.
In fact when the wind comes, the branches of trees shake,
but the branches of trees cannot cause the wind.
Therefore at the end of summer,
the field crickets chirrup,
and the cicades chirping,
since they are affected by the Yī1n fluid.
When thunder breaks out, the pheasants become frightened,
and when the insects awake from the state of torpidity, the snakes come forth,
since they are affected by the Yáng fluid.117
When it is near mid-night, the cranes cream,
and when it is about to dawn, the cocks crow.
Although these are not extraodinary events,
they also are the proofs that Heavenly fluid affects creatures,
and that creatures respond to the Heavenly fluid.
One merely can say that the air of cold and warm influences the sovereign,
and owing to being affected by the fluid (of cold and warm), the sovereign rewards and punishes.
How can one say that the sovereign affects high Heaven by his rewards and punishments,
and Heaven emits cold and warm to respond to the sovereign's political administration?
Those who study the Six passions by different winds say:
"When the wind comes,
robbers and thieves set to work under its influence."
It is not that the essence fluid of robbers and thieves affects Heaven,
then Heaven sends the wind.
When the wind blows, it sways their perverted minds,118
then their actions of robing and stealing come out.
How to prove this?
Robbers and thieves
seeing something, take it away,
and beholding a personal enemy, kill him,
all of these things happen in an instant,
it is not necessary that they have premediated for days,
and that the wind of Heaven arrives at the firce and cruel day. ???
Those who prdict deraness and cheapness by the wind hold that,
if the wind blows from residences of kings or ministers, then prices will be dear,
whereas if the wind comes from the dewellings of prisoners or dead men, then it will be cheap.
In fact prices may be different[dear or cheap],
but the Dǒu and the Hú [two measure instruments]are the old.
When the wind arrives, the sellers of grain raise or lower the prices,
because the heavenly fluid affects men.
Thus the prices of grain rises or falls,
and sometimes dear, sometimes cheap.119
It is said in the chapter Celestial Governor (of the Shǐjì) that,
on the morning of the first month, to divine what will predestinate this year by the wind blowing from the four directions,
if the wind blows from the south, there will be draught;
if it blows from the north, there will be inaudations,
if it blows from the east, there will be pestilences,
and if it blows from the west, there will be war.
The Great Annalist always based his judgement on facts.
He divined inaudations, draught, war, and pestilences by the wind,
because the destiny[good or bad luck] of men and other creatures depend on Heaven.
It is pring that makes things to grow up;
and it is winter that causes them to die.
But it is Heaven that dominates spring vivifying and winter killing.
If some hoped spring to kill and wintet to vivify,
things would neither die, nor grow up at all,
Why?
Because things growing up depends on the Yáng,
and their death depends on the Yīn.
Thus by blowing air upon one,
one cannot feel cool;
by breathing upon one,
one cannot feel warm.
But if the men who was blowed or breathed upon
goes through winter and summer,
he will have the trouble of chill or heat.
The cold and warm fluids
depend on Heaven and Earth, and are governed by the Yín and the Yáng.
How could human affairs and goverment administrations affect them?
Moreover, Heaven is the root and human being the apex.
Climbing up a tree, one can sway its branches,
but he cannot move its main trunk.
if the main trunk is cut,
then all the twigs wither.
Human affairs resemble the branches of a tree,
and cold and warm are like the root and trunk of a tree.120
Human being are born from Heaven,
are filled with the fluids of Heaven,
and they take Heaven as the master,
as the ear, the eye, the hand, and the foot are ruled by the heart.
When the heart intends to do something,
the ear hear and the eye see,
and the hand act and the foot move.
Now, if they maitain that Heaven responds to human being,
thus would they say that the heart is controled by the ear, the eye, the hand, and the foot?
Flags are hung down streamers,
and streamers flags are attached to the flagstaff,
hence, when the flagstaff moves eastward, those streamers follow and float westward.
If one says that cold and warm arrive accompanying with a sovereign's rewards and punishments,
this is equeal to regard heavenly fluids as the streamers (attached to the flagstaff).
That "Hook Star" appears between the "House Constallation" and the "Heart Constallation",
is a sign that there will be an earth-quake.
The Great Diviner of Qí was cognisant of this,
so he told Duke Jǐng:
"I can shake the earth."
Duke Jǐng believed him.
Now, to say that a sovereign can cause cold and warm
is like that Duke Jǐng trusted the Great Diviner being able to shake the earth.
In fact people cannot shake the earth,
hence they also cannot affect Heaven.
Now cold and warm
are heavenly fluids.
Heaven is the highest and the biggest,
and human being is very samll.
With chopsticks one cannot sound a bell,121
and with fire-flies one cannot heat a cauldron.
Why?
Because a bell is long[large], but chopsticks are short[small],
and a cauldron big, but fire-fly samll.
With a small body of seven feet high
one hope to affect the big fluid of the high Heaven,
this is sure that he cannot get the slighest effect.
To divine that a great governor is about to enter a territory,
(one knows that,) in case the air is cold, the governor will be angry,
and if it is warm, the governor will be pleased.122
In fact joy and anger are brought about by affairs.
Previous to his entering the territory,
a governor has not met with his officials and his common people,
and has not examined the affairs, right or wrong,
thus he has not shown his joy or anger,
but the cold and warm fluids have been there previously.
If one's anger and joy cause cold and warm,
then the air ought to arrive
after one has shown his anger and joy.
In this way, it must be cold and warm that evoke the sovereign's anger and pleasure .
Some will say:
"Maybe one has not shown one's sincerest.
By the things that have happened,
if one is as sincere as Zōu Yǎn who caused frost to fall by lamenting Heaven,
or as the wife of Qǐ Liáng who by her crying caused the city wall to collapse,
how can the heavenly fluids not be affected?"
Now, as for the greatest sincerity,
it is shown in the like and dislike of the heart.
(For example,) when some fruits and melons
are put before one's face,
and is no more than one foot away from one's mouth,
if one draws them with one's breath,
one cannot get them although he desire to eat them;
but if he takes them in his hand, and conveys them to his mouth,
then he can eat them.
Now as small fruits and melons,
they easily roll with their round body,
and are not far away from one's mouth,
but one cannot get them,
although one desires them very strongly.
How about Heaven then, which is very high and far away from us,
and whose fluids are boundless without begining and end?
In the mid-summer,
people stand against the wind;
and in the depth of winter,
people sit towards the sun.
The sincerity of their desiring to get coolness in summer and to obtain warmth in winter
is extreme.
Those who desire it very strongly
enve to the extent that sometimes they fan themselves although having standed against the wind,
and that they light a fire in a stove although having sat towards the sun.
But heaven will never change its fluids for winter and summer's sake,
bucause cold and hot' happening have their own principles,
they never change for people's sake.
Now even one desires to get it extremely, he still cannot obtain,
how much less so a servereign who merely practises his rewards and punishments without intention to get cold and warm? ???
Ten thousand people all make signs,
they cannot move Heaven,
how could the sobs of Zōu Yǎn alone
cause the frost to fall?
How could the predicament of Zōu Yǎn
be compared with that of Qū Yuán?
how could the injustice of being detained
be compared with that of jumping into the river?
and how could a sigh (of Zōu Yǎn)
be compared with the lamentation of the Lí Sāo and the Chǔ Cí ?
When Qū Yuán died,
there fell no frost in the State of Chǔ,
this was in the times of King Huái and King Xiāng.
About in the time of King Lì and King Wǔ,
Biàn Hé offered a jade-stone,
and had his two feet cut off.
He held the jade-stone in both his hands and wept,
till his tears ran dry, he went on weeping blood.
Now how could the sincerity of Zōu Yǎn
be compared with that of Biàn Hé ?
how could the injustice of being detained
be compared with that of feet being cut off?
and how could the signs towards heaven
be compared with weeping blood?
In fact (Zōu Yǎn's)sighs surely cannot be compared with (Biàn Hé's) weeping blood,
and (Zōu Yǎn's)being arrested surely cannot be compared with (Biàn Hé's) feet being cut off.
By measuring their injustices,
Zōu Yǎn was not as terrible as Biàn Hé,
but at that time (when Biàn Hé suffered his injustice) no frost was seen in the area of Chǔ.
Lǐ Sī and Zhào Gāo cause the death of the crown-prince Fú Sū by their calumines,
and Měng tián and Méng áo were involved.
At that time they all poured out the words of their grievances,
which resembled sighing;
Moreover their misfortune culminating to death
was not merely like being arrested and banished.123
But in the area where they died,
the cold air was not produced.
When Qín buried the alive soldiers of Zhào below Chángpīng,
all were buried simultaneously.
At that time their wails and cries
were not merely like (Zōu Yǎn's) signs.
Although their sincerity was less than that of Zōu Yǎn,
the injustice of 400, 000 people
should be appraised to equal the pain of one wise man;
and the cry while their falling into the cave
should be appraised to surpass the moans of one fattered prisoner.
However at that time
there was no frost was seen falling down below Chángpīng.
The chapter Fǔ Xīng of the Shàng Shū says:
"The people being killed universally explained to the Ruler of Heaven that they were innocent."
This means that Chī Yóu' s people suffering injustices,
they universally explanined to the high Heaven that they had no guilty.
With the cry of the masses,
they could not cause a fall of frost,
so the saying about Zōu Yǎn (causing a fall of frost )
perhaps is ficticious.
In the south it is extremly hot,
the sand burns, stones crumble into dust,
father and son bathe in the same water.
In the north it is extremely cold,
water turnes into ice, the earthe cracks,
father and son live together in the same cave.
Yàn is situated in the north,
and the time of Zōu Yǎn's signing
was the fifth month of the Zhōu Calendar,
which corresponds to the third month of the corrected year [the Xià Calendar].
In the central China frost and snows
often fall down during the first and the second month.
In the north it is extremely cold,
hence that froast falls down during the third month
cannot be considered to be an extraordinary thing.
This perpaps is that in the north it is still cold during the third month,
frost happened to fall down,
and Zōu Yǎn cried at that time by chance,
which just coincided with the frost.
The old book says:
"In Yàn there was a Clod Valley,
where the five grains did not grow."
Zōu Yǎn blew his flute,
and the Cold Valley became warm again.
Since he could make the air warm,
then also could make the air cold.
How do we not believe [know] that in order to make the contemporaries to know his injustice,
Zōu Yǎn manifested his sincerity through the heavenly air,
and secretly blew his flute at the jail in the Cold Valley to make the air cold,
then pretended to cry to Heaven ?
If it were not like so,
why did the frost fall?
Fàn Suī was slandered by Xū Jiǎ,
Wèi Qí punished him,
breaking his main body and seperating his ribs.
Zhāng Yí went about Chǔ selling his idea,
the prime minister of Chǔ arrested him,
he suffered beating with blood running out.
The two men were treated injustly,
so the Great Annalist narrated their cases.
Zōu Yǎn being arrested
resembled Fàn Suī and Zhāng Yí,
but why did Zǐ Cháng[the Great Annalist] avoid to mention this?
By examining Zōu Yǎn's biography (of the Shǐjì),
it is not mentioned that he caused a froast to fall for his imprisonment.
Thus it must be a fabrication and a unfounded statement
just like the story of Prince Dān, who made the sun to return to the merdian again, and made heaven to rain grain.
By judging from this,
that Zōu Yǎn caused the frost to fall through his crying (to Heaven)
is untrue.
and that the wife of Qǐ Liáng by her crying caused the city wall to collapse
is false.
Dùn Móu rebelled,
Zhào Xiāngzǐ led his army to attact it.
When his army arrived under the foot of the city wall,
the city wall of Dùn Móu collapsed more than one hundred feet,
Xiāngzǐ beat gongs and recalled his troops.
Now if it was due to that the wife of Qǐ Liáng's crying caused the city wall to collapse
then was there anybody crying among the troops of Xiāngzǐ?
When Qín was about to be extinguished,
the gate of the capital collapsed towards its inner.
And when Huò Guāng's family was going to ruin,
the wall of his house was demolished of itself.
Who was weeping in the Qín palace,
and who was crying in the house of Huò Guāng?
Thus the collapse of the gate and the demolition of the wall
were signs of the ruin of the Qín state and Huò's family.
Perhaps the Qǐ state was about to ruin,
and the wife of Qǐ Liáng happened to cry at the foot of the wall,
as Zōu Yǎn chanced to cry (to heaven) when the weather happened to be cold in the Yàn State.
The events were similar and the time was coincident,
so among those who heard about it, some believed it.
Moreover, when the city was old, and its wall was rotten,
there also is a collapse or a destruction.
If a woman's crying
could make 50 feet of the wall tumble down,
then she could push over a pole of 21(or 26) feet high with her one finger.124
During the period of Chūn Qiū several mountains were changed,???
mountains and walls of the city
belong to the same class.
If one's crying could collapse a city wall,
could it demolish a mountain also?
If one believes that the river flowed
after Duke Jǐng wore a white silk dress( mourning apparel) and cry to the river,
then it is surely necessary to believe that a city wall can be collapsed by the crying (of the women).
By inspecting, we know that when Qǐ Liáng joined the army,
he died and did not return.
When his wife went to met the coffin containing his corpse,
the Prince of Lǔ condoled on the road,
his wife did not accept the condolence.
After the coffin had been taken to her house,
the Prince of Lǔ went to condoled.
It is not mentioned that his wife cried at the foot of the city wall.
Qǐ Liáng actually died in the campaign.
Since he died in the campaign, he did not die in the wall,
then the city wall to which his wife cried,
was not the right place.
Thus it also an unfounded assertion that
the wife of Qǐ Liáng by her crying caused the city wall to collapse.
On the analogy of this,
both that a white halo pierced the sun when Jīng Kē stabbed the king of Qín
and that Venus eclipsed the Pleiades when Mr.Wèi drew up the stratagem of Cháng Píng for Qín,
are unfounded sayings too.
Yù Ràng planed to murder Xiāng Zǐ,
he lay under a bridge,
when Xiāng Zǐ arrived the bridge, his heart throbbed.
Guàn Gāo intended to murder Gāo Zǔ,
he concealed a man inside the wall,
when Gāo Zǔ arrived at Bó Rén, his heart also throbbed.
The two men hoped to murder the two sovereigns,
the two sovereigns' hearts beat fast.
If basing our judgements on facts,
we still cannot admit that the princes were affected by the two men's spirits.
then how much less so did a white halo pierce the sun when Jīng Kē planed to stab the king of Qín,
and the king's heart was not moved???
Thus a white halo piercing the sun
was a nature change, and happened of its own accord,
